intro: Senecio phagnaloides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. It is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Senecio phagnaloides is known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a hardy and resilient species.
